Position: Project Officer

Number of Positions: 1

Location: Belbari, Morang

Time: Full-time

Salary: Negotiable

Reporting to: Director

Project: Advancing Rights and Inclusion in Sexual and Reproductive Health and Education (ARISE)

Duration: 1.5 years

Position Description

Blind Youth Association Nepal (BYAN) is seeking a qualified and experienced candidate for the position of Project Officer based in Belbari, Morang. The Project Officer will work primarily in the field and will report directly to the Director, while carrying out activities under the close supervision of both the Director and the Chapter President.

The Project Officer will be responsible for the effective implementation of the project at the field level, coordinating with partners and stakeholders including government agencies, civil society organizations, organizations of persons with disabilities, children and young people with disabilities, and their parents/teachers. The role requires ensuring that project activities are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

About the Project

The project “Advancing Rights and Inclusion in Sexual and Reproductive Health and Education (ARISE)” aims to strengthen disability-inclusive sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) in Morang and Jhapa of Koshi province by empowering young people with disabilities through access to SRHR knowledge and information, sensitizing parents, teachers, schools, decision-makers, and service providers on the SRHR issues of young people with disabilities, improving SRHR services, and strengthening the disability movement by working with OPDs, CSOs, and other agencies. The project also advocates for improved SRHR policies and their effective implementation at provincial and local levels.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the planning, implementation, and day-to-day management of the project in line with organizational values and project objectives.
  • Develop detailed work plans, budgets, and implementation schedules and ensure timely delivery of project outputs.
  • Prepare and maintain high-quality project documentation, including progress reports, financial tracking inputs, case stories, and learning briefs.
  • Coordinate and maintain strong working relationships with provincial and local governments, OPDs, CSOs, schools, health service providers, community groups, and donors.
  • Lead advocacy initiatives at local and provincial levels to promote disability-inclusive SRHR and CSE policies and practices.
  • Mobilize, mentor, and support SRHR champions to deliver community-level SRHR and CSE sessions.
  • Facilitate SRHR, CSE, and disability orientation sessions in schools, health facilities, and community platforms.
  • Oversee the design, production, and dissemination of research and SRHR/CSE-related IEC materials in accessible formats.
  • Coordinate with media agencies and communication teams to promote positive narratives on disability and SRHR.
  • Ensure effective monitoring, documentation, data management, and timely reporting in line with donor and organizational requirements.
  • Ensure safeguarding, ethical standards, and confidentiality are maintained while working with children, young people, and marginalized communities.
  • Perform field-level activities as required and report to the Director, working in close coordination with the Chapter President and Central Office.

Job Specifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Public Health or a related Social Science field with at least two years of relevant professional experience; experience in project coordination or management is preferred.
  • Strong knowledge of national and international frameworks related to SRHR, CSE, and disability, including UNCRPD, SDGs, the Act Relating to Rights of Persons with Disabilities, and the Constitution of Nepal.
  • Demonstrated understanding of SRHR issues faced by young people, particularly persons with disabilities.
  • Experience in advocacy, community mobilization, and stakeholder coordination.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and social media campaigning.
  • Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in diverse and inclusive environments.
  • Proactive, self-motivated, and able to work independently in field-based settings.
  • Fluency in both Nepali and English is required; knowledge of sign language or accessible communication methods is an added advantage.
  • Prior experience working with children and young people with disabilities and/or the LGBTIQ+ community is an added advantage.

Application Deadline

The deadline for submitting applications is 20th Jan, 2026.

How to Apply:

Interested and eligible candidates are requested to send their application, along with an updated CV and expected salary, to hr@byanepal.org with the subject line: “Application for the Post of Project Officer – Morang.”

We encourage online submission of proposals. Phone calls, video calls, and SMS will not be entertained.

BYAN promotes inclusion across gender, caste, ethnicity, Dalit, and disability. Persons with disabilities and LGBTIQ+ individuals are strongly encouraged to apply. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further processes. The organization reserves the right to reject any/all applications without assigning reasons.

Blind Youth Association Nepal (BYAN) is seeking a qualified and experienced candidate for the position of Field Mobilizer based in Birtamod, Jhapa. The Field Mobilizer will work primarily in the field and will report directly to the Project Officer, while carrying out activities under the close supervision of both the Director and the Project Officer along with the Chapter President.

The role requires ensuring that project activities are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

  • Support the Project Officer in the preparation and implementation of the project activity plan at the field level.
  • Assist in organizing and facilitating community-level youth leadership, SRHR and CSE sessions, orientations, workshops, and dialogues.
  • Coordinate with OPDs, schools, health facilities, youth groups, and local stakeholders to ensure effective field implementation.

  • Support basic monitoring and documentation of project outputs and outcomes as guided by the Project Officer.
  • Ensure safeguarding, confidentiality, and ethical standards while working with children, young people, and marginalized communities.
  • Provide logistical and coordination support for trainings, workshops, and field events.
  • Perform other field-related tasks as assigned by the Project Officer and Chapter Office.

Job Specifications

  • At least one year of experience in community mobilization, youth engagement, social work, or development projects is preferred.
  • Basic understanding of SRHR, CSE, youth issues, and disability inclusion; strong willingness to learn and apply knowledge in the field.
  • Experience working with children, young people, and persons with disabilities is highly desirable.
  • Ability to prepare simple field-level progress reports and maintain basic project records.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively with diverse community members.
  • Willingness and ability to travel frequently within project areas and work in field-based settings.
  • Fluency in Nepali and basics in English is required; knowledge of local languages is an asset.
  • Knowledge of sign language or accessible communication methods is an added advantage.
  • Commitment to inclusion, safeguarding, and rights-based approaches.

Application Deadline

The deadline for submitting applications is 20th Jan, 2026.

How to Apply:

We encourage online submission of proposals. Phone calls, video calls, and SMS will not be entertained.

BYAN promotes inclusion across gender, caste, ethnicity, Dalit, and disability. Persons with disabilities and LGBTIQ+ individuals are strongly encouraged to apply. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further processes. The organization reserves the right to reject any/all applications without assigning reasons.

People Promote Center (PPC), Dhanusha is a nonprofit, non-government, and nonpolitical humanitarian and development organization working in all eight districts of the Madhesh Province. It is registered in District Administration Office, Dhanusha and is affiliated with Social Welfare Council, Nepal. The core working themes of the organization are education, WASH, DRR, Health, governance and advocacy and gender issues. The organization’s target groups include children, girls, adolescents, women, youth, and people with disability and other marginalized groups. The organization has been working with governments, development organizations (I/NGOs), and private sectors.

PPC is seeking a dynamic professional to lead the implementation, monitoring and quality assurance of gender-responsive and climate-resilient education initiatives in partnership with the province and local governments, and development partners in the Madhesh province.

  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders and facilitate joint monitoring, advocacy, and resource mobilization.
  • Prepare reports, case studies, and other documents as per the programme and organizational requirements.
  • Support education in emergencies initiatives as relevant.

Requirements:

  • Proven experience in education sector, programme planning, implementation, monitoring and coordination.
  • Strong communication, facilitation, and networking skills.
  • Proficiency in Nepali and English; local languages of Madhesh Province preferred.

PPC respects child rights and strictly follows the child protection policy of the organization. PPC is an equal opportunities employer and strictly follows the merit-based selection.

All rights regarding conduct of examination, cancellation and selection of candidates shall be vested in PPC.

Position: Database Officer

Job Description

Nyaya Health Nepal is looking for a Database Officer to strengthen our data management systems, support evidence-based decision making, and enhance our organizational learning culture. The Database Engineer will join a team of IT professionals working to customize, develop and inmplement Electronic Health Record System at rural low resource settings. Applications are accepted on an immediate, rolling basis.

The Organization: Nyaya Health Nepal

Nyaya Health Nepal (NHN) is a Nepal-based NGO delivering healthcare to underserved communities in Nepal in close partnership with the Government of Nepal. We deliver care to nearly 200,000 people every year through an integrated healthcare approach that strategically uses technology and data to improve continuity of care and reduce morbidity and mortality in rural settings.

Our goal is to leverage insights generated during service delivery to inform public healthcare policy and strengthen Nepal’s health system.

For more details, please visit our website: www.nyayahealthnepal.org

The Opportunity: Are you the right fit?

We are seeking a Database Officer who will oversee the development, maintenance, and optimization of NHN’s data systems. The role requires strong technical skill, attention to detail, and the ability to work in environments that require creativity and efficient problem-solving with limited resources.

Job Specification

Management Structure

Reports To: Senior Impact Manager

Direct Reports: None (may supervise interns/assistants as needed)

Location: Based on Kathmandu but may need to travel to implementation sites

Must-Have Qualities:

  • Strong alignment with NHN culture, ethics, and patient-centered values
  • Solid technical skills in SQL, EHR, DHIS2, and data system development
  • Good time and task management with ability to handle multiple workflows
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Clear communication in English and Nepali
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Experience in data quality, dashboards, and documentation is an advantage

Big 3 Responsibilities:

1. Database Development, Migration, and Optimization for the Integrated EHR Platform

  •  Perform migration and optimization of existing databases.
  •  Normalize and cluster current databases to improve performance.
  •  Design and develop database architectures for various systems.
  • Collaborate with the team to ensure products are delivered on time and according to requirements, from planning through implementation.
  • Enhance system integrations across platforms such as OpenMRS, OpenELIS, Odoo, DCM4Che and DHIS2.
  •  Provide regular updates to the Team Lead on progress and challenges.
  •  Write complex and diverse queries based on organizational requirements.

2. Agile Development Responsibilities

  •  Estimate the effort required to implement user stories.
  •  Contribute to achieving sprint goals through development tasks.
  •  Implement relevant test cases.
  • Conduct unit tests and initial acceptance testing.
  • Identify blockers and report them to the Scrum Master.
  • Work in a self-organized manner within the team.
  •  Participate in daily Scrum meetings.

3. Quality Delivery and Ownership of the Integrated EHR Product

  • Deliver work only after thorough testing.
  •  Prepare technical documentation for all completed tasks.
  •  Provide technical insights when needed, clearly explaining technical concepts to the Team Lead.
  •  Coordinate and communicate with the global Bahmni coalition if required.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Participate in all project phases, including requirement gathering, design, and development.
  • Design, write, and maintain efficient, reliable database and queries.
  • Support EHR development and implementation, including training staff and clinicians in the effective use of NepalEHR.
  •  Provide feedback to EMR/EHR developers to support product improvement.
  • Assist the team with generating reports from the database.
  •  Optimize existing databases to improve overall system performance.
  • Manage database query components for DHIS integration.

Note: The above responsibilities are not exhaustive. The Database position may be assigned additional duties as directed by the line manager.

Forum for Rural Welfare and Agricultural Reform for Development (FORWARD Nepal) is a nationally recognized non-governmental organization working to enhance sustainable livelihoods, promote inclusive rural development, and strengthen climate-resilient and agriculture-based economies in Nepal. In order to support its programmes and institutional operations, FORWARD Nepal invites applications from qualified and committed Nepali citizens based in Chitwan for the following position.

Position: Admin and Finance Officer – One (Only Female)
Location: Chitwan

Brief job descriptions

The Admin and Finance Officer (AFO) will be responsible for the overall administration and financial management of FORWARD Nepal and its projects, and will be accountable for ensuring transparency, accountability, and an efficient administrative and financial management system in line with organisational policies, donor requirements, and prevailing laws and regulations of Nepal. The AFO will oversee budgeting, financial planning, accounting, cash and bank management, procurement, assets and inventory, payroll, taxation, and statutory compliances, and ensure timely and accurate financial reporting to management, donors, and governing bodies. The role also supports human resource functions, ensuring legal and regulatory compliance, particularly with the Social Welfare Council (SWC), District Administration Office (DAO), and local governments, including registration renewals, agreement management, and timely submission of required reports and documents. In addition, the AFO will support organisational management by strengthening internal control systems, facilitating internal and external audits, and ensuring timely implementation of audit recommendations. S/he will provide clear guidance and capacity support to project teams on financial management, donor compliance, and administrative procedures, and will contribute to institutional strengthening of FORWARD Nepal through effective coordination, documentation, and adherence to organisational manuals, board decisions, and partnership agreements.

Educational qualification and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Studies, Management, or an equivalent discipline, with at least 5 years of relevant work experience in the development/NGO sector or Preferred Master’s degree in similar discipline with 3 years of experience in a similar role within the development sector.
  • Proven experience in administration and financial management of donor-funded projects.

Professional Experiences

  • Demonstrated experience in establishing, implementing and strengthening organisational administration and finance systems, financial policies, procedures, internal controls and compliance mechanisms
  • Proven experience in overall organizational financial management, including budgeting, financial planning, accounting, cash and bank management, payroll, taxation, statutory reporting and financial analysis.
  • Experience in office administration and management, staff management, logistics, procurement, inventory control, asset management and documentation systems.
  • Strong experience in human resource administration, staff recruitment processes, personnel file management, contracts, attendance and leave management, payroll coordination, performance appraisal support and staff compliance with HR policies
  • Hands-on experience in supporting the development, review and implementation of organisational policies and manuals such as financial, administrative, HR, procurement, and safeguarding policies
  • Experience in managing and ensuring compliance with labour laws, social security fund (SSF), income tax, VAT/TDS and other statutory requirements applicable in Nepal
  • Proven track record in donor compliance and project administration, including alignment of organisational systems with donor rules and partnership agreements
  • Experience in coordinating and facilitating internal and external audits, organisational assessments and due diligence processes and ensuring timely follow-up of audit findings
  • Ability to provide technical guidance, coaching and oversight to project and field teams on administrative, financial and HR procedures.
  • Strong coordination experience with management, Board, donors, government offices, banks, auditors and other stakeholders to ensure smooth organisational operations and compliance

Skills and Competencies

  • Strong knowledge of financial policies, internal control systems, and risk management
  • Proficiency in computerised accounting software and MS packages.
  • Ability to provide technical guidance and capacity support to project and field teams on financial and administrative procedures
  • Strong analytical, organisational, and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication, coordination, and reporting skills
  • High level of integrity, accountability, and attention to detail

Salary and Benefits

  • Salary and benefits for above mentioned position will be as per project provisions and FORWARD Nepal HR policy.

Application Procedure

Interested female candidates who meet these criteria can submit their application with the latest updated CV, a cover letter, and contact details of two professional references via the link https://forms.gle/Ebv5xrnj2eiUx6io9 by 17th January 2026. Please visit https://www.forwardnepal.org/announcements for further information.

FORWARD Nepal is an equal opportunity employer and strongly encourages applications from disadvantage groups (Women: Dalit, Janajati, Madhesi, People Living with Disability) and local residents during recruitment process.

The Staff Hiring Committee of FORWARD Nepal reserves all rights to make the final decision. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a written examination. Telephonic enquiries shall not be entertained and any effort to influence to do so will result in disqualification. FORWARD Nepal reserves the right to reject and cancel this vacancy and application without assigning any reason whatsoever.

Interested candidates meeting the above criteria are requested to submit:

  • Updated Curriculum Vitae (CV)
  • Cover letter clearly indicating suitability for the position
  • Contact details of at least two professional referees
  • Applications should be submitted by the deadline mentioned above.

Staff Hiring Committee
FORWARD Nepal

ES Outsourcing, is a leading Australia-based Engineering and CAD Outsourcing Consultant with its office located in Kathmandu, Nepal. We provide full-fledged Engineering & CAD Services specializing in transforming Architectural Drawings into accurate, build-ready Structural Plans. Besides, we are also providing our services in many other different arenas of Engineering and CAD Services.

Our expertise bridges the gap between design and construction, ensuring that every structure is safe, compliant, and constructible. We are a well-established and leading company providing full-fledged CAD Engineering Services to leading players in Engineering domain across Australia to all major Architectural and Engineering Firms including in other parts of the Globe. Our expertise includes CAD 2D Drafting and Drawings as well as 3D Modeling and other Services.

We work closely with Architects, Engineers, Builders (Contractors & Sub-contractors), Developers and other stakeholders who are part of the Building Projects helping to convert conceptual designs into precise structural drafting packages, tailored to Australian Standards (AS/NZS) and local council requirements.

Our team combines years of experience in structural engineering, CAD drafting projects to deliver detailed and accurate drawings that meet the demands of residential, commercial and infrastructure projects across Australia.

For our Nepal Office, we are looking for highly skilled, enthusiastic, experienced, competitive and dedicated candidates with long term commitments of minimum of 2 years for the following positions:

Qualification:

Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering with moderate to high level professional skills in AutoCAD 2018 for Drafting of mainly Structural and other Non-Structural Drawings and detailing of highly complex Building and other Civil Engineering Projects.

Work Experience:

2-3 Years of solid work experiences in AutoCAD 2018 for Structural/Non-structural Drawing and Detailing of Complex Residential Building and Civil Engineering Projects in the reputed Consulting Architectural/Engineering Firms or other organizations. Must be also very good in Excel and Word Software.

Salary & Perks:

Purpose of the position

To assist in preparing, managing, and maintaining documentation for tenders, RFPs (Requests for Proposal), RFIs, PQQs, and ITTs related to IT services, software development, hardware, cloud solutions, cybersecurity, finance, accounting and digital transformation projects.

Responsibilities & duties

  • Assist in reviewing tender/RFP documents to identify documentation requirements, compliance needs, and submission guidelines for IT projects;
  • Support the collection of inputs from technical, sales, finance, legal, and project teams (e.g., resumes, case studies, certifications like ISO, technical specifications);
  • Help in formatting, editing, proofreading, and compiling bid/proposal/project sections under senior guidance;
  • Maintain document version control, organize files, and update backups to ensure accuracy;
  • Contribute to consolidating inputs from various contributors into cohesive proposal documents;
  • Assist in managing and updating the bid library/repository with templates, reusable content, past proposals, and supporting materials specific to IT tenders;
  • Work with the team in the collation of information and to ensure deadlines are met;
  • Support for the timely submission of bids physically or by uploading documents on e-tendering portal;
  • Participate in document reviews, providing inputs on clarity, grammar, and presentation;
  • Track bid-related communications, clarifications, and amendments;
  • Prepare basic supporting materials, such as executive summaries or presentations, for bid clarifications;
  • Undertake statistical analysis and research on assigned tasks;
  • Identify trends and recommend proactive or remedial action to manage business projects and plans;
  • Manage a demanding and reactive workload in a responsive way to assist the seniors to meet the team’s key objectives;
  • Gather critical information by consulting different sources to produce best report and documents for the projects;
  • Acquire knowledge of all the standards, procedures and methods that is needed for departmental duties and performance;
  • Perform other duties assigned by the seniors.

Essential skills, abilities & knowledge

  •  Should be proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint);
  •  Should possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
  •  Should possess the ability to cope with pressure and challenges;
  •  Should be a team player;

Academic & trades qualifications

  • Freshers

We appreciate all applications, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Jalpa Integrated Development Society (JIDS) Udayapur is a non-political and non-profitable NGO established in 1994 by a group of Udayapur marginalized group activists. Since then, JIDS Udayapur is fully dedicated to work in humanitarian assistance, community development, livelihood, child well-being, and environmental protection mainly in the Hilly region of Nepal through the humanitarian and long-term development projects.

In partnership with World Vision International Nepal, JIDS Udayapur have been implementing “Sponsorship Operation Program (SOP) and Core Project Models of Citizens Voice and Actions, Child Protection” through the integrated programme framework (IPF) to ensure wellbeing of most vulnerable children and families in two Municipalities Triyuga and Katari, and Four Rural Municipalities Rautamai, Limchungbung, Udayapurgadhi and Tapli. JIDS Udayapur is seeking qualified, dynamic and motivated Nepali citizens on following positions.

  • Proven project management and financial management experience,

title.rendered: Equity, Rights and Social Safeguards Technical Specialist

content.rendered:
Position: Equity, Rights and Social Safeguards Technical Specialist

Purpose of the role

As the Equity, Rights and Social Safeguards Technical Specialist, you will lead the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of ZSL’s approach to Environmental and Social Safeguards (FAIRER) across ZSL programmes in Nepal and India, in line with ZSL’s FAIRER framework, IUCN’s Environmental and Social Management System (ESMS) and national legislation.

With a particular emphasis on leading Free, Prior and Informed Consent (FPIC) processes for the programme, you will ensure that local and Indigenous communities meaningfully participate in decisions that affect their lands, resources and livelihoods. You will also ensure that local people engaged in ZSL’s conservation activities are protected from harm, that concerns can be raised safely and confidentially, and that ZSL staff, partners and representatives uphold the highest standards of behaviour and accountability.

You will work to ensure that activities are implemented equitably, responsibly and in full compliance with environmental and social safeguards, ensuring that all interventions align with ZSL’s FAIRER Safeguards Framework, the IUCN ESMS and national regulations that respect human rights and promote equitable conservation outcomes. The role will be based in-region, located within ZSL’s Nepal office, and will oversee and support ESMS implementation and monitoring in Uttar Pradesh, India, working with ZSL’s implementing partner, the Wildlife Institute of India, under the Integrated Tiger Habitat Conservation Programme (ITHCP) Phase IV project.

You will ensure that ZSL meets its duty of care in relation to the Prevention of Sexual Exploitation, Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH), as well as other safeguarding policies as required, and that these align with Environmental and Social (E&S) safeguard compliance and monitoring requirements. You will work closely with the FAIRER Programme Co-Manager, ZSL’s ESMS Officer in Nepal, Project Managers in India and Nepal, and community organisers in both countries.

Key responsibilities: 

  • Manage all Environmental and Social Safeguard requirements, including the design, implementation and review of mitigation measures.
  • Oversee the implementation and monitoring of safeguarding frameworks to prevent and respond to all forms of exploitation, abuse and harassment within the organisation with a focus on community partners.
  • Design culturally appropriate FPIC processes that respect traditional governance, decision-making, and customary land and resource rights, ensuring FPIC is a lived consent process in line with ZSL’s Inclusive Engagement and FPIC safeguard.
  • Embedding ESMS, safeguarding and PSEAH principles into community engagement, education, and conservation activities, ensuring these are aligned with ZSL’s organisational values and global standards.
  • Work with community liaison officers to communicate environmental and social safeguarding instruments with local actors and local partners, ensure safeguarding instruments meet community needs and create positive action interventions to support communities, and in particular, vulnerable groups.
  • Lead on Environmental and Social Safeguarding reporting and documentation in line with the project reporting requirements and updating of safeguarding instruments.

About You

  • A degree (or equivalent professional qualification) in social science/development studies or a similar relevant field (e.g. international politics or political ecology) or relevant experience in implementing E&S safeguarding systems working with local actors.
  • Track record of implementing and managing Environmental and Social Safeguarding Instruments (including FPIC, Grievance Mechanisms, Stakeholder Engagement Plans and Indigenous Peoples Plans) across diverse stakeholder groups and ensuring a duty of care is adhered to.
  • Prior experience of delivering social equity and inclusion processes with experience leading work with a gender equity and social inclusion focus.
  • Ability to think critically and analyse complex and nuanced problems – the post holder will be capable of dealing with complex matters and communicating them effectively and in a timely manner.
  • Knowledge of safeguarding standards (e.g. CHS, IASC, Core Humanitarian Standards) and an understanding of safeguarding and Protection from Sexual Exploitation, Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH) principles, frameworks, and best practice in international and community contexts.
  • Fluent English and Nepali (spoken and written)
  • Good knowledge of current and emerging best practice related to National and International Environmental and Social Safeguards instruments, human-rights laws, environmental rules and regulations and Free Prior Informed Consent (FPIC) processes.
  • Good working knowledge and demonstrated experience of international frameworks related to Free Prior Informed Consent and the rights of Indigenous Peoples.

ZSL is committed to conservation led by those who know their environments best. We work hand in hand with local communities and conservationists around the world, united in our mission to protect wildlife and power sustainable solutions globally.

We encourage applications from members of the communities we work with, and from those who share our passion for conservation and collaboration. At ZSL, we value respect, local knowledge, and shared purpose, together, we can make a real difference for wildlife, people and planet.

About Us

We’re ZSL, an international conservation charity. Through our unrivalled animal experts in our two zoos (London Zoo and Whipsnade Zoo), the work of our pioneering scientists, our dedicated conservationists, our purpose is to inspire, inform and empower people to stop wild animals going extinct. Our vision is a world where wildlife thrives and we’re working every day to achieve this. From investigating the health threats facing animals, to helping people and wildlife live alongside each other, we are committed to bringing wildlife back from the brink of extinction.

What do we offer?

At ZSL, we are proud of our approach to employee benefits. Our benefits include:

Our vision and purpose – you’ll work alongside colleagues who are passionate about science-led conservation, knowing that you will help us to inspire, inform and empower people to stop wildlife going extinct
Holidays – 19 days paid annual leave during each 12-month period worked, plus national and public holidays as per the Labor Act of Nepal.
Wellbeing – Accidental insurance for staff and medical insurance for staff (including family members)
Maternity leave and paternity leave available as per Labor act of Nepal.

NB: We reserve the right to close our advertisement early or extend the advertising date until a suitable candidate has been found.

Advertising End Date: 22 Jan 2026

Position: HR Manager

Purpose of the role

Based in Nepal, this role plays a vital part in creating a safe, supportive and high-performing workplace where people can thrive. You will lead on Human Resources and Health & Safety, working closely with managers to strengthen recruitment, retention and people management practices across the country programme.

As a trusted partner to the Country Representative, and working in close collaboration with the Senior HR Business Partner in the UK, you will help translate organisational people strategies into practical, locally grounded solutions. From ensuring full compliance with Nepal’s Labour Code and statutory requirements, to supporting managers through recruitment, employee relations and wellbeing initiatives, you will be at the heart of building a positive and inclusive working culture.

This role offers a unique opportunity to shape how people are supported, developed and protected within an INGO setting, balancing operational HR delivery with a strong commitment to human rights, equity and effective ways of working. Through your expertise, you will help ensure that ZSL Nepal remains a responsible employer and a place where staff feel valued, supported and empowered to do their best work.

Key responsibilities: 

  • Liaise effectively with the Department of Labour to ensure compliance with the Labour Code and all applicable statutory requirements, including human rights obligations, and advise staff on labour legislation and employment standards.
  • Manage and execute the full recruitment cycle from vacancy announcement through job offer and induction for resourcing needs within the scope of the local HR role, in close coordination with the Country Representative, and the Senior HR Business Partner.
  • Support the Country Representative with employee relations cases, including grievances and disciplinary.
  • Support the Country Representative and Senior HR Business Partner to implement people initiatives and projects including developing pay structures, wellbeing initiatives and effective ways of working.
  • Oversee contract and benefits administration, including the issuance, renewal, and amendment of contracts for staff, consultants, interns and other personnel.
  • Plan and coordinate staff orientation including partners, training sessions, workshops, and related activities as required and aligned with organizational needs.

About You

  • Minimum of five years of progressive experience in HR at Officer level or above within the INGO sector.
  • Master’s degree in business management, HR Management, or a related field, or equivalent professional qualifications; equivalent knowledge and skills may also be demonstrated through relevant practical experience.
  • Proven experience in recruitment, staff management, handling grievances, and managing disciplinary cases.
  • Hands-on experience in implementing the Nepal Labour Act, Social Security Fund (SSF) and ensuring compliance with employment contracts.
  • Familiarity with Nepal Labour Act, Human Rights Act, GESI principles, and other relevant legislation governing HR management.
  • Ability to maintain and use HR data and metrics to inform strategic decision-making

We encourage applications from members of the communities we work with, and from those who share our passion for conservation and collaboration. At ZSL, we value respect, local knowledge, and shared purpose, together, we can make a real difference for wildlife, people and planet.

Through our unrivalled animal experts in our two zoos (London Zoo and Whipsnade Zoo), the work of our pioneering scientists, our dedicated conservationists, our purpose is to inspire, inform and empower people to stop wild animals going extinct. Position: Knowledge Management & Learning Officer

Job Description

Overall Purpose of the Job:

Under the supervision of Program Manager, the Knowledge Management & Learning Officer is responsible for strengthening the quality, use, and management of program data, evidence, and knowledge across TLMN projects and Anandaban Hospital. The position establishes and maintains effective monitoring, accountability, and information systems by systematically collecting, collating, validating, analyzing, and synthesizing data from multiple sources.

Key Task & Responsibilities:

Monitoring & Reporting:

  • Lead the process of timely KPI compilation for TLMN projects and Anandaban Hospital following verification and analysis.
  • Develop and analyse databases; maintain data, reports, and case story repositories.
  • Support programs team in data analysis to track progress and generate evidence.
  • Provide technical support in developing M&E plans including surveys and evaluations.
  • Support Programs Manager on monthly, semiannual, and annual donor reports.
  • Provide technical input for data management portals.
  • Conduct monitoring visits and share high-quality MEAL reports.
  • Systemize and manage key external data.
  • Develop and share factsheets and dashboards quarterly/semiannually.

Project Development:

  • Ensure consistent MEAL methodology across programs.
  • Support visibility of TLMN through coordination with partners.
  • Provide technical support for situation analysis and project design.
  • Support country strategic planning and lead MEAL components.
  • Participate in annual reviews and reporting.
  • Identify opportunities for new programs.
  • Support proposal writing and lessons-learned documentation.

Evaluation and Learning:

  • Support strategic reviews and evaluations.
  • Provide technical support for mid-term and final evaluations.
  • Promote cross-project learning.

Capacity Building:

  • Build and nurture MEAL community of practice.
  • Ensure staff access relevant capacity-building opportunities.

Accountability:

  • Demonstrate accountability in decisions and resource management.
  • Hold teams and partners accountable for results.

Safeguarding:

  • Support safeguarding policies and awareness.
  • Ensure beneficiary feedback mechanisms.
  • Report safeguarding concerns appropriately.

Person Specification:

  • Bachelor’s with 5 years or Master’s with 3 years relevant experience.
  • Experience in inclusive development, health, or disability.
  • Strong skills in Excel, SPSS/STATA preferred.
  • Strong analytical, reporting, and communication skills.
  • Fluency in Nepali and English.

Application ends January 17, 2026

Position: Project Manager

Overall Purpose of the Job:

Project Manager is responsible for project oversight, project cycle management, technical guidance, monitoring/supervision, and developing/maintaining responsive engagement with provincial and municipal governments and internal/external stakeholders in Madhesh Province. The role ensures quality planning, implementation, monitoring, and reporting to the Programs Manager.

Key Task and Responsibilities:

Provide Project Level Leadership:

  • Demonstrate strong leadership and team management skills.
  • Ensure effective coordination, collaboration, and communication among stakeholders.
  • Translate strategic goals into actionable project plans.
  • Apply sound decision-making and problem-solving in dynamic environments.
  • Strengthen staff capacity through learning and use of national and WHO tools.
  • Ensure implementation of TLMN core policies, including safeguarding.

Project Implementation:

  • Provide managerial and capacity-building support for project implementation.
  • Align project activities with national leprosy and TLMN strategies.
  • Represent the project in provincial and municipal coordination forums.
  • Provide technical oversight for work plans, budgets, and M&E plans.
  • Monitor grant financial management and project delivery.
  • Review progress updates and financial reports.
  • Coordinate and supervise technical capacity building for staff and partners.
  • Support annual staff training plans in collaboration with HR.

Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning:

  • Act as data custodian and maintain project data systems.
  • Establish systems for monitoring and continuous improvement.
  • Report project progress monthly, semiannually, and annually.
  • Ensure effective coordination with partners.
  • Ensure complaint handling and feedback mechanisms function properly.
  • Coordinate regularly with TLM Nepal offices.

Accountability:

  • Demonstrate accountability in decision-making and resource management.
  • Hold teams and partners accountable for performance and results.
  • Perform additional duties as assigned by the Line Manager.
  • TLM Nepal has a zero-tolerance policy toward abuse, neglect, and exploitation. The post holder must comply with all organizational safeguarding policies and codes of conduct.

Person Specification:

  • MBBS with Master’s in Public Health or related discipline and minimum 5 years’ experience.
  • At least 3 years’ experience in leprosy and/or LF programs.
  • Strong understanding of country-led health strategies.
  • Experience across health, disability, and education sectors preferred.
  • Established professional relationships with key sector stakeholders.
  • Strong coordination skills with government, donors, and partners.
  • Ability to lead and influence across multiple teams and levels.

Application ends January 17, 2026

Position: Research Officer

Job Description

Overall Purpose of the Job:

Participate in the research data collection, data management and data analysis of the ongoing research studies. Ensure compliance of the research activities with approved protocol and overall research objectives.

Under the supervision of the Principal Investigator, the Research Officer will involve him/herself to research activities in designated working station and will:

  • Carry out research data collection according to approved research protocols.
  • Perform various core data collection activities including baseline, midline and end-line quantitative and qualitative data collection at various time points.
  • Create presentation slides and posters to help researchers present findings.
  • Assist in development, planning and management of research projects in coordination with Principal Investigator (PI).
  • Meet regularly with PI and others to discuss research study related topics.
  • Assist Project Manager to prepare and finalize project reports to be submitted internally or externally throughout the year.
  • Ethical management of human participants in research studies.
  • Review existing available research study related SOPs and documents.
  • Contribute in the development of relevant research articles (manuscripts and research proposals).
  • Handle logistics support for ordering, inventory, maintenance and repair of equipment and supplies.
  • Actively participate in various workshops and training.
  • Enthusiastic for working in an interdisciplinary team and preparedness to work in other research projects when necessary.
  • Report to line manager for any issues regarding research study related issues.

Person Specification:

  • Bachelor’s degree in public health or other relevant fields with at least 2 years of working experience in related fields.
  • Should possess competency in good clinical practice.
  • Should have sound knowledge and experience of quantitative and qualitative data collection skills.
  • Willingness to travel to data collection sites regularly.
  • Priorities will be given to those holding driving license.
  • Demonstrated skills on handling data collection software like REDCAP, KOBO, MWATER etc.
  • Analytical, observation, technical, and time management skills.
  • Demonstrated experience in the implementation of similar research and data collection methodologies.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in Nepali and English.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated experience in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and other software.

Application ends January 17, 2026

Position: Programme Associate (Nutrition), SC L6

DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS: 18 January 2026-23:59-GMT+05:45 Nepal Time (Kathmandu)

WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.

ABOUT WFP

The World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP’s values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.

To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org and follow us on social media to keep up with our latest news: YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok.

WHY JOIN WFP?

  • WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
  • WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.
  • WFP invests in the personal & professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.
  • A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
  • We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).
  • WFP encourages female candidates and people with disabilities to apply.

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE OF THE ASSIGNMENT:

The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) is the world’s largest humanitarian organization, saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity for people recovering from conflict, disasters, and the impact of climate change.
Working in Nepal since 1963, WFP has extensive knowledge of the socio-economic context of Nepal as related to food and nutrition security, livelihood creation as well as logistics capacity and emergency response. At present, WFP Nepal operates across the country with tailored programming based on present and predicted needs. Being a trusted UN partner, WFP is uniquely well-placed to support the Government, as well as local communities to tackle the underlying factors causing malnutrition in all its forms.

WFP launched its corporate Nutrition Strategy (2024-2030), and since 2024, WFP Nepal implements its country strategic plan which directly aligns with the Government’s 16th Plan, as well as the United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework for Nepal. WFP supports the Government’s efforts to reduce malnutrition, increase access to food and build sustainable food systems under Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 2 and to enhance global partnerships under SDG 17, whilst supporting SDG 4 on quality education and SDG 13 on climate action. Under the country strategic plan, support is provided through four outcomes:

Outcome 1: Affected and at-risk populations in Nepal meet their food, nutrition and other essential needs before, during and after shocks and other stressors.
Outcome 2: School-age children and adolescents and nutritionally deprived groups in Nepal have improved education and nutrition outcomes and greater access to affordable, nutritious and safe diets, including through social protection programmes, by 2028.
Outcome 3: Smallholder farmers and climate vulnerable populations in Nepal benefit from climate-resilient and equitable food systems, sustainable livelihoods and climate-proof assets and services by 2028.
Outcome 4: Communities vulnerable to and affected by crises in Nepal benefit from improved common services and enhanced capacities of Government and humanitarian and development actors by 2028.
To strengthen the Government’s capacity to implement integrated health and nutrition programming at local levels, WFP is seeking a Programme Associate (Nutrition) to support WFP nutrition programming and technical assistance.

TERMS AND CONDITION

Position Title: Programme Associate (Nutrition), SC L6

Contract Type: Service Contract (SC)

Level: SC L6

Contract Duration: 6 months (renewable)

Duty Station: Rajbiraj, Nepal

Deadline of Application: 22.01.2026

WFP offers a competitive benefits package including salary plus CIGNA health insurance

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under the technical guidance of the Programme Policy Officer (Food Fortification) (Kathmandu) and the direct supervision of the Programme Coordinator (Janakpur), the job holder will carry out the following tasks:

Capacity Strengthening

  • Provide technical and operational support to the Government at local and provincial level during planning, implementation, monitoring, evaluation and learning of nutrition programmes with an emphasis to nutrition-sensitive social protection (including Mother and Child Health and Nutrition), and nutrition in emergency, as well as inclusion of social and behaviour change communication works across the Multi-Sector Nutrition Plan implementation.
  • Support the development of nutrition programming as part of the Provincial and Local government’s annual planning processes.
  • Support needs assessment and organize/facilitate nutrition orientation, review workshop, training and refresher courses to help develop the capacity of Government personnel at different government tiers in coordination with the country office.
  • Participate as a resource person in training/orientation and/or consultative/advocacy meetings related to nutrition as required.
  • Provide support towards development or adaptation of Government guidelines, manuals, and protocols for nutrition programmes.
  • Provide support for the implementation of the Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition Programme (IMAM), per national protocol during emergency and regular settings.

Coordination and Partnership

  • Attend local, district, and provincial Government fora and share information that enhance WFP’s collaboration with Government agencies and support building and sustaining effective collaborative relationships with government stakeholders.
  • Facilitate support to government and non-government partners (Cooperating Partners) implementing nutrition programmes.
  • As needed, support effective planning, implementation and follow up of shock-responsive social protection initiatives for vulnerable groups as per the national priorities/schemes.
  • Support the organization of nutrition advocacy meetings to lobby for increased resource allocation, strengthen multi-sectoral linkages, and promote best practices at local, district and provincial levels.

Monitoring, Evaluation and Reporting

  • Organize regular joint supportive supervision/coaching visits from different levels of Governments, followed by a review meeting to reflect on the observations of the joint visit.
  • Provide technical support to government personnel in regular reporting, analysis, interpretation, sharing and use of nutrition data from the Health Management Information System (HMIS/DHIS2) and other sources.
  • Support design and implementation of assessments, evaluations and/or research as needed.
  • Prepare and submit periodic progress reports to the Government and WFP country office.

Programme Support

  • Provide support to the country office in development of Concept of Operations to ensure the needs of the government are reflected in WFP’s emergency preparedness and response plan.
  • Support country office in periodic reporting along with weekly programme input, country brief and others.
  • Conduct other tasks as required, to support the day-to-day activities of the country office.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Education: Completion of secondary school education. A post-secondary certificate in related functional area and/or a bachelor’s degree in public health, nutrition or related fields is desirable.

Experience:

  • At least six years of experience in Public Health Nutrition or related fields.
  • Experience providing technical assistance at national, provincial, or district level.
  • Experience and expertise in delivery of nutrition prevention and treatment programmes including social and behavior change communication.
  • Experience negotiating, training, communications, advocacy, and resource mobilization.
  • Knowledge and experience of UN and Government partnerships will be an asset.
  • Has collaborated with technical teams (i.e., nutrition), implementing programmes and observed or assisted with policy discussions.

Desired Skills:

  • Functional competencies in supporting designing/planning of nutrition-specific and nutrition-sensitive programming; nutrition emergency preparedness and response, child and maternal health, IYCF/MIYCN, IMAM, SBCC, among other.
  • Sound understanding of nutrition-related policies, and systems of Nepal
  • Good negotiation skills and ability to communicate effectively
  • Ability for perform well in cross-disciplinary teams.
  • Training and experience in utilizing computers and standard software packages and systems, such as MS Office.

Languages:

Fluency in both written and spoken Nepali and English languages. Knowledge of local languages will be an added value. Nepali Typing skill is an asset.

Position: Programme Associate (Field Coordinator-School Meals)

DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS: 22 January 2026-23:59-GMT+05:45 Nepal Time (Kathmandu)

WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.

ABOUT WFP

The World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP’s values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.

To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org and follow us on social media to keep up with our latest news: YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok.

WHY JOIN WFP?

  • WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
  • WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.
  • WFP invests in the personal & professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.
  • A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
  • We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).
  • WFP encourages female candidates and people with disabilities to apply.

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE OF THE ASSIGNMENT:

ABOUT WFP

The United Nations World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian agency fighting hunger worldwide. The mission of WFP is to help the world achieve Zero Hunger in our lifetimes. Every day, WFP works worldwide to ensure that no child goes to bed hungry and that the poorest and most vulnerable, particularly women and children, can access the nutritious food they need.

ORGANIZATIONAL CONTEXT

Job holders operate with a high degree of independence, manage more junior staff to ensure that programme and policy objectives are achieved in full. They are usually involved in a wide variety of programme and policy activities and analytical work, some of which may be of a considerable complexity. At this level, job holders are expected to contribute to performance improvement.

JOB PURPOSE

The Government of Nepal, with support from WFP, has implemented the Mid-day Meal Programme since 1974. Today, the programme spans all 77 districts across the country’s seven provinces, targeting more than three million children in over 27,000 schools and providing meals every school day, making it one of the largest social safety nets in the country. Through external support provided through several public and private donors, WFP has provided direct implementation support to the national programme for decades, and, by the end of 2025, will transition its three remaining districts to the national Mid-day Meal programme. From January 2026 onward, WFP will continue providing technical assistance and system strengthening support for an efficient and effective Mid-day Meal programme.

Despite strengthening policy frameworks, growing operational experience, and increased investments, gaps still remain in translating the policy into practice at the sub-national level (Province, District and local government) affecting the continuity, quality, and sustainability of the Mid-day Meal Programme. In late 2024, the government, under the leadership of the Minister of Education, Science and Technology, took the bold decision in developing and approving a national home-grown school feeding framework which paved the way to scaling up the home-grown school feeding approach in 250 of the country’s 753 Municipalities in the next three years starting from 100 Municipalities in fiscal year 2025/2026. This will, among other things, entail strengthening local government capacity to enhance and support the quality of implementation of the Mid-day Meal programme through the home-grown school feeding approach. In collaboration with the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology and provincial and local governments, WFP has successfully tested a context specific home-grown school feeding models that provide multiple benefits for children, the local communities, the country at large and have the proven potential to offset some of the implications of the limited cash allocations from the federal level.

In line with the government’s plans for scaling up the Home-Grown School Feeding framework, WFP aims to continue provide technical assistance in improving the quality of implementation of the national Mid-day meals programme through working closely with local governments and the school community. As such, WFP is seeking multiple Field Coordinators to be based in district headquarters to provide technical assistance to a cluster of local governments.

The Field Coordinators will be responsible to provide overall technical assistance to respective municipalities to strengthen local government and stakeholder capacity to implement the Mid-day Meal programme, and to adopt a home-grown school feeding approach in line with the Government’s home-grown school feeding framework.

TERMS AND CONDITION

Position Title: Programme Associate (Field Coordinator – School Meals) SC L6

Contract Type: Service Contract (SC)
Level: SC L6

Contract Duration: 12 months (renewable)

Duty Station: Parbat, Sindhupalchowk (Chautara), Jumla, Baitadi, Bajhang (2 posts), Darchula, Bajura

Deadline of Application: 22.01.2026

WFP offers a competitive benefits package including salary plus CIGNA health insurance

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES (not all-inclusive, within delegated authority)

Under the overall guidance of the School Meals Manager and the supervision of a Programme Coordinator (Dhangadhi, Janakpur, or Surkhet, depending on location) the field coordinator will be responsible to:

Provide timely and quality technical assistance in the preparation and implementation of annual workplan for the local governments through facilitating and ensuring that the Mid-day Meal programme and its associated activities are well reflected in local level plans and policies and promote a multisectoral approach to school meals. Provide training and other capacity strengthening activities for government, school, smallholder farmers/cooperatives and community stakeholders. Support local governments operationalize the home-grown approach through coaching and mentoring, following the National Home-Grown School Feeding Framework. Support local governments to develop and contextualized procedures and guidelines to address the local needs under the Mid-day Meal programme with a home-grown approach including food procurement, contracting between schools and smallholder farmers and their cooperatives. Provide technical assistance on menu planning, social behaviour changes activities and support the monitoring and accountability system for the Mid-day Meal programme. Support strengthens local government capacity to identify potential collaboration and partnership opportunities for home-grown school feeding and related activities at municipal/ward/community level. Hold regular meetings with local governments, school staff and committees, farmers, cooperatives and other stakeholders to review workplan, progress, identify challenges and jointly develop solutions to address them. Represent WFP in different forums related to school meals at the district and municipal levels within a specific technical area of responsibility. Perform other duties as required or assigned by the immediate supervisor.

Qualifications & Experience Required

Experience:

At least 6 years of relevant experience in implementing technical programmes at field level (i.e., education, agriculture, nutrition, food systems, etc.). Experience working in teams and coordinating groups of diverse stakeholders. Should have experience contributing to design and implementation of programmes and must have deep knowledge and experience in school meals, nutrition, and education programming. Experience in negotiations, communications and resource mobilization are valuable assets.

Education:

Completion of secondary school education. A post-secondary certificate in related functional area with focus on a relevant discipline: agriculture, nutrition, public health, development studies, social sciences, law, human rights, international development, or related field.

Knowledge & Skills:

Among other, must be able to (1) develop and maintain networks with variety of stakeholders; (2) facilitate workshops and group discussions; (3) professionally impart knowledge and technical expertise to partners and stakeholders; (4) flexibly adapt to changing contexts and needs; (5) participate in open dialogue and value diverse opinions, regardless of background, culture, experience, or context; and (6) explore and experiment new ideas and approaches in own work; and (7) work independently in a timely and organised manner.

The ability to work independently, to be a self-starter, motivated, and able to multi-task is essential for this role, and non-negotiable. Familiarity with the Microsoft Office suite is essential. Driving skills, as well as a valid license are required, as much time will be spent commuting between municipalities and district headquarters.

Language:

Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English and Nepali languages. Knowledge of local language will be an added advantage. Nepali typing skill is an asset.

Call for Consultant: 5-Year Strategic Planning for YKP LEAD Nepal

Position: Consultant – Strategic Planning Lead
Location: Kathmandu , Nepal
Duration: July – August 2025
Application Deadline:16th July 2025
Estimated LOE (Level of Effort): Up to 25 working days

About YKP LEAD Nepal

YKP LEAD Nepal is a youth-led and youth-serving organization committed to promoting the rights, wellbeing, and leadership of Young Key Populations (YKPs) and Young People Living with HIV (YPLHIV) in Nepal. Guided by the motto “For the youth, by the youth, and led by the youth,” we work to build leadership, strengthen advocacy, and create inclusive spaces for meaningful youth engagement.

Purpose of the Assignment

We are seeking a qualified and experienced Consultant to lead the development of a comprehensive 5-Year Strategic Plan (2025–2030) for YKP LEAD Nepal. This plan will serve as a guiding framework to strengthen our organizational vision, enhance programmatic impact, and align our goals with the evolving needs of YKPs and YPLHIV in Nepal.

Scope of Work

The Consultant will:

  • Conduct a situation and organizational capacity assessment, including stakeholderconsultations (with board, staff, partners, and youth networks).
  • Facilitate a strategic planning workshop with key stakeholders.
  • Develop clear strategic priorities, goals, outcomes, and implementation pathways.
  • Integrate monitoring, evaluation, and learning (MEL) components.
  • Provide a draft and final 5-Year Strategic Plan document with a costed implementation framework.

Deliverables

  • Inception report with methodology and timeline.
  • Stakeholder consultation summary report.
  • Strategic planning workshop facilitation
  • Draft Strategic Plan (2025–2030).
  • Final Strategic Plan (with logframe, MEL framework, and cost estimate).

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience in developing strategic plans, preferably for youth-led or community-based organizations
  • Strong understanding of the HIV response, key populations, and human rights in Nepal
  • Demonstrated facilitation skills and participatory planning experience
  • Excellent communication, writing, and analytical skills
  • Familiarity with national policies, the Global Fund, and community-led responses is an asset

How to Apply

Interested candidates are invited to submit:

  • A cover letter expressing your suitability and approach
  • Updated CV
  • Two samples of similar strategic plans or consultancies delivered
  • Financial proposal (daily rate and estimated budget)
  • Send applications to: ykap.nepal@gmail.com, rippuhamal@gmail.com
    Subject line: Name-Consultancy Application – Strategic Planning – YKP LEAD Nepal

We strongly encourage applications from women, Key Populations and people living with HIV.

TITLE OF POSITION: Field Coordinator-Child Sensitive Livelihood

GRADE/LEVEL: Coordinator

LOCATION OF THE POSITION: RWUA Working Area

IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR/ REPORTING TO: Sr./Project Coordinator/Manager

POSITION TO BE SUPERVISED: SUPERVISED: Officer/Supervisor

WORKING AREA: RWUA Working Area Sarlahi

CHILD SAFEGUARDING:

The position holder will frequently have direct contact with children and/or young people in their day-to-day work. S/he will have to abide by the child safeguarding, protection from sexual exploitation, abuse, and harassment (PSEAH) policy, including the RWUA code of conduct. S/he will have to maintain dual adult rules while visiting/meeting with children.

ROLE PURPOSE:

The Field Coordinator will operate under the guidance of the Sr./Project Coordinator/Manager to ensure the effective implementation of project activities, adhering to established standards and strategies. This role demands extensive field travel to project sites and collaboration with stakeholders to promote sustainable child poverty interventions. A key focus will be ensuring the sustainability of the Samunnati program’s learning, agriculture-related initiatives, and enterprise development efforts.

The position involves direct coordination with local governments, public agencies, and private organizations to integrate project objectives with the broader developmental landscape, ensuring long-term impact. The Field Coordinator is tasked with managing program planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring, technical support, and reporting under the sponsorship program’s child poverty theme.

Additionally, the role includes responsibilities for training, mentoring, and capacity building of project staff, conducting field-level assessments, and documenting success stories and lessons learned to support continuous improvement and stakeholder engagement.

SCOPE OF ROLE:

Reports to: Sr./Program Coordinator/Manager

Staff reporting to this post: Officer/Supervisor

Budget Responsibility: Sponsorship Program-Outcome-4

KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY:

Program Planning, Budgeting, and Monitoring

  • Develop annual budgets, implementation plans, and quarterly forecasts for the child poverty sub-theme.
  • Regularly track achievements against plans, expenditures, and procurement progress.
  • Identify deviations in project execution and provide justifications to ensure alignment with objectives.

Program Implementation

  • Implement livelihood interventions (on and off-farm), ensuring high-quality outcomes and adherence to annual and detailed implementation plans.
  • Facilitate market linkages for micro and small-scale enterprises and enhance leadership capacities of community groups.
  • Provide technical support for registration processes and financial linkages for entrepreneurs.
  • Monitor enterprise activities and recommend improvements for sustainability and growth.

Capacity Building and Supervision

  • Conducted needs assessments and designed training programs for marginalized groups.
  • Deliver technical training on business planning, financial management, and income generation.
  • Provide coaching, mentoring, and on-site support to field staff and beneficiaries.

Coordination and Networking

  • Establish strong relationships with stakeholders, local governments, and private sector partners.
  • Support farmer groups in accessing local planning resources and preparing proposals for funding.
  • Develop market linkages and integrate project efforts with other thematic areas for enhanced impact.

Data Management and Reporting

  • Manage data through OPMIS and ensure timely reporting.
  • Document case studies, lessons learned, and best practices for sharing with stakeholders and scaling up initiatives.

Representation

  • Represent the organization in educational forums, meetings, workshops, training, and seminars as directed.

Others

  • Perform dual roles in development and humanitarian work during emergencies.
  • Undertaking additional tasks as assigned by the Line manager under the sponsorshipprogram portfolio.
  • Prepared the Samunnati Program report according to the donor-required basic
  • Prepared Quarterly/Semi-annual Report/Annual Report according to the Donor’s and Organization requirements
  • Prepared AGM Report/organizational occasional program, Proposal Writing
  • Own a two-wheeler and a Valid driving License

QUALIFICATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in agriculture, Plant and Animal Science
  • Experience: At least three years of field experience in livelihood program implementation.
  • Expertise in business counseling for both on- and off-farm enterprises.
  • Familiarity with participatory community mobilization methods and child protection policies.
  • Experience in building collaborative relationships with diverse stakeholders.

Skills:

  • Proficiency in computing skills.
  • Strong communication, analytical, and report-writing abilities.
  • Basic proficiency in written and spoken English and Nepali
  • Enthusiasm for working with diverse, multidisciplinary teams and rural communities.
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate with relevant stakeholders.

Child Safeguarding

  • Ensure that all Program staff understand and respect the SC Child Safeguarding policy
  • Report protection concerns to the Program Coordinator/Manager in line with the SC Child Safeguarding policy
  • Ensure the Child Protection Policy and Code of Conduct are visible in all Save the Children activity locations
  • Ensure in each location of Save the Children work there is a reporting mechanism and Child protection focal person to report Protection concerns

Well-being

  • Ensure that all staff in the Program team feel comfortable in the job and team and inform the Sr. /Program Coordinator/Manager if the employees face particular challenges or have specific needs
  • He / She has to do any other job that the organization requires to make the program more effective and successful.
  • Others
  • Other tasks as requested by the Line Manager.
  • Support Humanitarian responses where appropriate, ensuring timely and quality responses per SCI standards and principles.
  • Facilitate Safer programming, Gender Diversity, and Climate resilience programming for long-term impact.

Child Safeguarding

  • Ensure that all Program staff understand and respect Save the Children’s Child Safeguarding and Child Protection Policies.
  • Report on the protection concerns to the Sr. /Program Coordinator/Manager in line with the Save the Children’s Child Safeguarding Policy.
  • Ensure the Child Protection Policy and Code of Conduct is visible at all Save the Children’s activity locations.

Well-being

  • Ensure that all staff members in the program team feel comfortable in the job and team and inform the Project Coordinator if the employees face particular challenges or have specific needs.
  • The job responsibilities as explained above are not exhaustive, and the position holder may be required to carry out additional duties within the reasonableness of their level of skills and experience for the goodwill of the organization.
  • Adopt and demonstrate the ‘Do No Harm’ Policy in each and every step of your assignments.

Note

Interested candidates aged above 25 years but below 45 years are encouraged to apply by submitting their updated CV and cover letter to vacancy@rwua.org, clearly mentioning the position applied for in the subject line, addressed to The Human Resource Department, Rural Women Upliftment Association (RWUA), Sarlahi. Alternatively, applicants may submit a hard copy of their application to the Rural Women Upliftment Association (RWUA), Haripur Municipality–02, Sarlahi, no later than 13 January 2026 by 4:00 PM.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the further selection process, telephone enquiries will not be entertained, and any form of inappropriate recommendation may result in automatic disqualification. RWUA maintains zero tolerance toward child abuse and strictly adheres to its Child Safeguarding Policy. RWUA is an equal opportunity employer and follows a strictly merit-based selection process. Qualified female and LGBTIQ candidates, individuals from disadvantaged communities, and local applicants with best-fit qualifications and competencies are strongly encouraged to apply. Applicants must clearly mention their age in years and state their expected basic salary in the application letter; applications not meeting these requirements may be considered invalid.

Rural Women Upliftment Association (RWUA), Haripur-02, Sarlaahi is a non-political, non-profit organization established 33 years ago on Kartik 22, 2050 B.S., with the vision of uplifting marginalized and rural women and communities. Since its inception, RWUA has been working in key areas including women’s empowerment, gender equality, social inclusion, education, health, livelihoods, child protection, Advocacy/lobbying, and transparent local governance, with a strong focus on Dalits, indigenous groups, persons with disabilities, and other marginalized populations. Through community-centred approaches, RWUA has supported capacity development, poverty reduction, counselling on foreign employment, assistance to vulnerable families, and overall empowerment.

RWUA, in partnership with Save the Children, has been funded, Implementing the Sponsorship (SAMUNNATI) Project in Sarlahi District since 2017 in Ishworpur and Haripur Municipalities, focusing on education, health, livelihoods, child protection, and advocacy, policy, and lobby, while continuing its recognised role as a leading gender / Child protection resource centre at district and regional levels.

RWUA now invites applications from interested and qualified Nepali citizens for the following position:

TITLE OF POSITION: Field Coordinator-Education

GRADE/LEVEL: Coordinator

LOCATION OF THE POSITION: RWUA Working Area ( Haripur 02 Sarlahi)

IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR/REPORTING TO: Program Manager

POSITION TO BE SUPERVISED: Field Officer

WORKING AREA: Haripur and Ishworpur Municipality, Sarlahi

CHILD SAFEGUARDING:
